title: How to Clean Stainless Steel Refrigerators

parts.name: Use Proper Material and Rubbing Techniques

steps.headline: Choose a nonabrasive cleaning cloth.
steps.description:
Stainless steel scratches easily, and even a mild kitchen scrubbing pad will mar the surface. Use a microfiber cloth. They work better than lint-free cotton because they leave less fibrous material on the surface of the stainless steel
Clean and shine your refrigerator with paper towels. If you want a super, non- streak shine, first clean the surface with the microfiber cloth and your favorite cleaning agent, and then wipe down the refrigerator with paper towels.

steps.headline: Clean with the grain.
steps.description: You may have to look closely to see the grain, but you will be able to detect which way the grain is going. Rubbing against the grain, even with a microfiber cloth, will leave permanent scratches on the surface of your appliance.

steps.headline: Use plain water.
steps.description: This is the cheapest method for cleaning your refrigerator, but stubborn stains and fingerprints will require extra rubbing or the addition of a few drops of dishwashing liquid soap. If you use soap, you will have to rinse off the surface with clear, hot water before you dry it with a paper towel. (Dry it quickly so that it doesn’t streak.)

steps.headline: Clean with oil.
steps.description: Any vegetable oil, including olive oil, will clean stainless steel. You can also use baby oil; cleaning with oil does require extra drying to soak up the oil, this cleaning method leaves a very glossy shine but a darker shade.

steps.headline: Try white vinegar and water on your appliance.
steps.description: Mix the two together in a spray bottle, using 3 parts white vinegar and 1 part water. Spray on your refrigerator and wipe it down with paper towels. Vinegar is excellent at cutting through greasy fingerprints.

steps.headline: Use commercial cleaners.
steps.description: Some people prefer the convenience of glass cleaning products and products that are sold specifically for cleaning stainless steel appliances.
